name: Grand Library â€“ Under-Table Thread-the-Needle
description: Inspired by the forum discussion on extreme low-clearance maneuvers, this level recreates a dim main reading room in a mansion-sized library. A gigantic antique wooden table dominates the centre of the space, its thick carved legs creating a tight tunnel that the drone must slip beneath.  The operator starts just outside the reading room doorway, dives low to slide between two legs, and pauses over an old radio (the intel pick-up).  Poor lighting and slow sensor refresh make depth-perception tricky; the lighting level has therefore been dialed down and the ping delay increased.  After the data is collected, the pilot must discover an exit partially blocked by a wooden chair shoved part-way under the table, forcing a delicate sideways crab through a gap only centimetres wider than the quadcopter.  Passing a final checkpoint beyond the chair, the drone then exits to a safe corner immediately outside the room to complete the run.
